annotation.spannedText: Vaccines work by making us produce antibodies to fight disease without actually infecting us with the disease

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines work by making us produce antibodies to fight disease without actually infecting us with the disease

annotation.spannedText: Immunisation helps to improve protection against life-threatening diseases at the very earliest opportunity

classMention.mentionClass: Immunisation helps to improve protection against life-threatening diseases at the very earliest opportunity

annotation.spannedText: Some vaccines provide very high levels of protection

classMention.mentionClass: Some vaccines provide very high levels of protection

annotation.spannedText: As the threat decreases, it's important to keep vaccinating, otherwise the disease can start to spread again

classMention.mentionClass: As the threat decreases, it's important to keep vaccinating, otherwise the disease can start to spread again

annotation.spannedText: When a vaccination programme against a disease begins, the number of people catching the disease goes down

classMention.mentionClass: When a vaccination programme against a disease begins, the number of people catching the disease goes down

annotation.spannedText: If enough people in a community are vaccinated, it's harder for a disease to pass between people who have not been vaccinated

classMention.mentionClass: If enough people in a community are vaccinated, it's harder for a disease to pass between people who have not been vaccinated

annotation.spannedText: Herd immunity is particularly important for protecting people who can't get vaccinated because they're too ill or because they're having treatment that damages their immune system

classMention.mentionClass: Herd immunity is particularly important for protecting people who can't get vaccinated because they're too ill or because they're having treatment that damages their immune system

annotation.spannedText: The more infectious the disease, the greater the number of people who have to be vaccinated to keep the disease under control

classMention.mentionClass: The more infectious the disease, the greater the number of people who have to be vaccinated to keep the disease under control

annotation.spannedText: As more of the population is vaccinated, the disease can sometimes disappear completely and the vaccination programme can be stopped

classMention.mentionClass: As more of the population is vaccinated, the disease can sometimes disappear completely and the vaccination programme can be stopped

annotation.spannedText: If 95% of children are protected by MMR, it's possible to eliminate not just measles, but mumps and rubella as well

classMention.mentionClass: If 95% of children are protected by MMR, it's possible to eliminate not just measles, but mumps and rubella as well
